properties.value: The golden warbler is a golden bird that players can capture with the Hunter skill at level 5 or above, granting 47 Hunter experience. Catching one is a requirement for the Easy Desert Diary.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Golden warbler
Golden warbler
Released21 November 2006 (Update)
Combat level5
MembersYes
LocationUzer Hunter area
ExamineActually, golden screecher might be a more appropriate name.
Advanced data
NPC ID5551

The golden warbler is a golden bird that players can capture with the Hunter skill at level 5 or above, granting 47 Hunter experience. Catching one is a requirement for the Easy Desert Diary.

Contents

  • 1 Location
  • 2 Hunter info
  • 3 Hunting technique
    • 3.1 Multiple traps
  • 4 Description
  • 5 Changes
    • 5.1 Gallery (historical)

Golden warbler
Level required 5
Hunter XP47 xp
RetaliationNo
TrapBird snare
Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Bones1Always700
Raw bird meat1Always2510
Yellow feather5–10Always615–1,23035–70

The catch rate is 36% at lvl 1 and 157% at lvl 99.[1]

Hunting technique[edit | edit source]

A golden warbler being caught.

The hunting technique is the same as for other birds. Players must set up a bird snare and wait until a bird gets stuck in it. Players may repeatably use the same bird snare. Bird snares are available for purchase in Hunter shops.

Multiple traps[edit | edit source]

Bird snaring can be done with multiple traps at once, with the maximum number of traps depending on the player's Hunter level.

Traps
1 1
20 2
40 3
60 4
80 5

Description[edit | edit source]

Parts of this article are copyrighted by Jagex.
It has a direct quote, copied verbatim, from Old School RuneScape or the Old School RuneScape website.
“ The golden warbler can be easily identified by its hideously annoying song. Although the warbler is prized by hunters for its fine feathers, it is probably caught just as much simply to shut it up. ”
 
— William Oddity's Guide to the Avian
